壎字的基本解释

壎
xūn
同“埙”。

壎字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xūn］
［《廣韻》況袁切，平元，曉。］
亦作“坃1”。亦作“塤1”。亦作“壦1”。
古代一种吹奏乐器。陶制，也有用石、骨、象牙制成者。大如鹅蛋或鸡蛋，顶部稍尖，底平，中空，有球形或椭圆形等多种。顶上有吹口，前面有三、四或五孔，后面有二孔，古今各异。

壎字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　壎； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页240第34
〔古文〕坃壦【唐韻】況袁切【集韻】【韻會】許元切，?音暄。樂器也。燒土爲之，銳上平底，形似稱錘。【白虎通】壎之言熏也。陽氣于黃泉之下，熏烝而萌也。【詩·小雅】伯氏吹壎。亦作塤。【爾雅·釋樂】大塤謂之嘂。嘂，音叫。【孫炎曰】音大如叫呼聲。【前漢·律歷志】八音，土曰塤。【禮圖】塤大如鴈卵者曰雅塤，如雞卵者曰頌塤。○按塤乃土器，不堅之物，故時俗指人慣弄虛澆者曰弄塤。【宋景祐·樂記】今大塤八孔，二前五後，一髹飾其上。　又【集韻】許云切，音熏。義同。　又吁運切，音訓。盂也。　【集韻】與塤同。

Basic explanation of words

Health
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xūn］
["Guang Yun" Kuang Yuan Qi, Ping Yuan, Xiao. ]
Also known as "坃1". Also known as "Xun 1". Also known as "壦1".
An ancient wind instrument. Pottery is also made of stone, bone, and ivory. It is as large as a goose egg or an egg, with a slightly pointed top, flat bottom, hollow, and spherical or oval shapes. There is a mouthpiece on the top, three, four or five holes in the front and two holes in the back, which are different in ancient and modern times.
Health
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Ugly Collection] [The Department of Soil Characters] 　壎; Kangxi strokes: 17; Page number: page 240 34
[Ancient text] 坃壦[Tang Yun] Kuang Yuanqie [Ji Yun] [Yunhui] Xu Yuanqie,? Yinxuan. Musical instruments too. Burn the earth to make it, sharp on the flat bottom, shaped like a weighing hammer. 【Baihutong】The words of health are also smoked. The yang qi is under the yellow spring, and it is so beautiful and adorable. [Poetry·Xiaoya] Bo's blowing health. Also as a xun. 【Erya·Shile】Da Xun is called Zhi Xun. Hey, the sound is called. [Sun Yan said] The sound is as loud as a cry. [Previous Han·Lü Lizhi] Eight-tone, Tuyue Xun. 【Ritual Picture】A Xun who is as big as a goose egg is called Ya Xun, and a person who is like a chicken egg is called Song Xun. ○According to the xun is a clay vessel, not a hard thing, so the time folk refers to people who are accustomed to making false pourings called nang xun. [Song Jingyou·Le Ji] Today Daxun has eight holes, two in the front and five in the back, and one is decorated with it.　[Ji Yun] Xu Yunqie, Yin Xun. The same meaning.　 Another appeal for luck, sound training. Yu also.　【Jiyun】Same as Xun.
